tutorial:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<output>
  <ticket>
   <line>
      <text align="center">
        How to use
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
        1. Click on the configuration button
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
        2. Load the Web POS module labels, using the AD_MESSAGE.xml file
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
        3. Optionally load a translation file from a translation module
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
        4. Load a JSON file containing a ticket data.
        You can obtain this from the WebPOS local database
        Or from the Data Import Entry (Archive) window(s)
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
        5. Paste into this editor your ticket's xml
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
        6. Edit your ticket freely, rendering is updated automatically
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
        7. By printing the page you can obtain a PDF of the ticket to send to someone else
      </text>
      <line>
        <text align="center">------------------------------------------</text>
      </line>
      <text align="center">
          Check Openbravo's wiki to know how to build a ticket
      </text>
    </line>
  </ticket>
</output>
